I had a similar experience. I was going the same way you were in green but a driver turned right into my car when she is supposed to be going straight only thinking I was going to turn right (i was not signalling). I still asked if she was ok or not and she was shaken  saying sorry and all. I wondered afterwards why my insurance claim was taking so long and my insurer told me they asked for 50:50 because she submitted a statement saying I was speeding on the other lane and I came out of nowhere. I told them I was not going to waste any more time on this and will get my lawyer involved. 100% almost immediately after.
There are spin doctors so statements immediately are useful  if you can get one.
Thanks for sharing. Yup  a lot of actors and actresses nowadays who donâ€™t conform to their lanes properly  but when it comes to taking responsibility  all of a sudden itâ€™s everyoneâ€™s fault.

Whats the typical mileage for tyres?
depends on a lot of factors
how often you maintain tyre pressures
what kind of tyres you're using  econo tyres or performance compounds etc
every tyre type different in compound  tread and composition
Majority on Singapore road. Sometimes on malaysia roads. On Fuel-saving Eco tyres (not budget). Rarely goes off road
say you run a tyre with lower load index than recommended by manufacturer
the best way to measure tyre life is not to use KM
but tread wear indicator or tread depth gauge
what weight each tyre is rated to

there will be a standard bar in the middle of the trad pattern
if your tread is close to or at the bar already you should consider changing

Usually new tyres are at 8 to 9mm tread depth and you can drive until they reach 1.6mm but it's recommended to change when they reach 3mm

The first DSG transmission  the DQ250 (02E)  is introduced in a series-production car during the launch of the Golf Mk4 R32 back in 2003. During the design Volkswagen AG combined the advantages of manual and automatic transmissions into one completely new gearbox generation: the direct shift gearbox (DSG). It has been especially designed for VAG vehicles with an engine torque up to 350-380 Nm like the sportier versions of the Golf (GTI and R models).
